avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches released in the area January 28-30th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has gained strength in thaw, but new wind slabs can form on top.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow subsided and partly melted in warm weather and rain on 31.1.-1.2. Temperatures at high elevation went above freezing for a time, but part of the precipitation has probably fallen as snow. New wind slabs can form at high elevations the next few days, in various aspects due to variable wind.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Næstu daga er útlit fyrir að hiti í fjallahæð sveiflist í kringum frostmark. Lítil úrkoma á sunnudag í fremur hægum vindi, bætir í austanátt með snjókomu um kvöldið. Breytilegur vindur frá A-N-V á mánudag með rigningu, slyddu og snjókomu. Allhvöss SV átt á þriðjudag með éljum eða snjókomu til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several avalanches fell in the area last week, and while temperatures were rising on Friday January 31st.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is considered stable after thaw. New wind slabs may form on Monday and Tuesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow subsided and melted in warm weather and rain on 31.1.-1.2. and should now be homogeneous and stable. Snowfall and snowdrift on Monday and Tuesday could form new unstable wind slabs on top of the stable snow.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Kólnar á sunnudag og dregur úr úrkomu og vindi. Snjókoma eða slydda í hvössum NA-N-NV áttum á mánudag. S-SV éljagangur á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm and strong winds on Friday and Saturday. Wet snow avalanches may have occurred, and might release while air temperatures are above freezing. Wind slabs may form on Sunday and Monday as snowfall continues in southerly winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm and strong winds on Friday and Saturday. Temperatures have reached close to 10°C at mountain elevations, and the snowpack is expected to have become relatively isothermal, strengthening once freezing. Wet snow avalanches may have occurred widely during the peak of the warm spell, and there is a risk of avalanches while freezing has not occurred. Wind slabs may form on Sunday and Monday as snowfall continues in southerly winds.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar éljagangur í hvassri sunnanátt aðfaranótt sunnudags en búist við meiri sunnan snjókomu á sunnudagskvöld og úr mánudaginn í hvössum vindi. Það snjóar til fjalla en gæti rignt eða verið slydda á láglendi um tíma.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wet avalanches have likely released in the mountains during warming on Friday and Saturday. Slush flows released onto roads in southern East fjords.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm temperatures and rain on Friday and Saturday. There is a risk of wet snow avalanches in the mountains while temperatures are still above freezing. Wind slabs may form on Sunday and Monday as snowfall continues in southerly winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm temperatures and rain on Friday and Saturday. There is a risk of wet snow avalanches in the mountains while temperatures are still above freezing. After very warm weather in the area the snow pack is expected to have subsided and is likely isothermal in upper elevations. Wind slabs may form in the mountains on Sunday and Monday as snowfall continues in southerly winds.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Kólnandi veður en áfram suðlægar áttir. Á sunnudagskvöld og fram á mánudag má búast við töluverðri snjókomu til fjalla sem gæti verið rigning eða slydda á láglendi. Rigning á mánudag.
